Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ljb_294
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my friend, we requested a twin room. The beds were together so we separated them & were thrilled when we got back from our day out that the staff had rearranged the furniture for us to have separate beds. The room was very spacious, plenty of places to hang wading lines from too. The breakfast was 5 euro extra but definitely worth it for the convenience & free wifi in the breakfast room. There was a grocery store across the road, chemist next door and train/tram station within a few 100 metres. Overall, great stay in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hostel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveler7788
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. It was a complete dump and the worst hostel I've ever stayed in. I stayed in the hotel, not the hostel. Unfortunately, the room I got stuck in stunk of urine so bad, I was gagging all night. There was a beer festival down the street, so I can only assume that the person who stayed there before me was so wasted that he decided it was too much trouble to urinate in the bathroom, so he instead pissed all over the bed and floor. Well, I hope he enjoyed himself, because the hotel was fully booked and I couldn't get another room and was thus forced to breathe in his disgusting fumes for 2 nights. Seriously, it is that hard to get up to pee? Anyway, the staff didn't speak a word of English either, which was not helpful in dealing with this or any other issue. Also, the bathroom had a lot of mold and the carpets in the entire suite were filthy and disgusting. One of my roommates down the hall spilled a bottle of coke on the carpet and we didn't bother to clean up because we thought it added to the decor quite nicely. DON'T stay here, there are plenty of other hostels to stay in Berlin, such as Wombat's.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little place in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Alycia614
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and I really enjoyed it. The rooms were comfortable, I had a shared bathroom, but being in the spring there weren't many people there and I always had the bathroom to myself. It's very close to the train and a 15 minute walk to the Berlin Wall Memorial.
